snippet.title: 10 reasons why the Ubuntu Phone should be your next mobile device
snippet.description: Looking for your next smartphone? Jack Wallen explains why the Ubuntu Phone should be your mobile solution.

snippet.title: GNOME 3.10 has resurrected what was once the darling of the Linux desktop
snippet.description: Jack Wallen examines the state of the GNOME 3.10 desktop. His conclusion might surprise you.

snippet.title: What the Lenovo purchase of Motorola Mobility means to the Android landscape
snippet.description: The Lenovo purchase of Motorola Mobility could turn the mobile landscape on its head. Jack Wallen takes a look at what it means for Android now that Lenovo is the third largest pro...

snippet.title: Google Glass: Will its fate be Tablet PC or first iPhone?
snippet.description: The hottest tech product of 2013 has started to lose some its luster on the eve of CES. Still, there are couple things to keep in mind about Google Glass.

snippet.title: Security's weakest link: Technology no match for social engineering
snippet.description: A security researcher says there is a 100-percent success rate any time pen-testing uses social engineering to target victims. Here are some of the techniques used.

snippet.title: Leverage tablets to augment physical processes
snippet.description: Too often, organizations look at technologies like tablets merely as a means to replace the old way, when the better alternative may be to augment and enhance the process.

snippet.title: Microsoft Office lands on iOS
snippet.description: Patrick Gray takes a look at Microsoft Office Mobile, a long-rumored version of Microsoft Office for iOS devices.

snippet.title: And now, for something completely different...
snippet.description: Something funny I had show to me on the holiday. This came out after Dubya was re-elected back in 2004. Not written by Cleese, but still good for a laugh. =================== A...

snippet.title: The Internet of Things: What you need to know
snippet.description: The Internet of Things has emerged as one of IT's hottest trends of 2013. We have a great set of resources to help you figure out how it can help your business.

snippet.title: Scapple proves powerful mind-mapping app for Mac users
snippet.description: Scapple is a newly-released app for Mac users that aims to simplify the way you take notes, capture ideas for brain-storming, and map processes.
